Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below, with red band at top; exterior: maeander pattern running left around rim; below, from left, part of vertical maeander dividing band; painted decoration consisting of goat (rump, tail and part of underbelly remaining) to right; corner pendant roundel and swastika as filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, as the sherds from this group display patterns on the different parts of the vessel which are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 237, no. 165, pl.15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0204) (phase 2)
